element.name: Living Wood
element.description:
Living Wood are sentient plantfolk deliberately created by druidic circles to serve as companions, assistants, and guardians of the natural world. Through ancient rites blending druidic magic with living timber, these beings are grown rather than born—shaped with emotions, cognition, and moral reasoning comparable to humanoids. Living Wood are alive, aware, and capable of choice—crafted to endure where others pass on.
TRAITS Ability Score Increase. Increase one ability score of your choice by 2.
Creature Type. You are a Plant.
Size. You are Medium or Large (your choice). Medium Living Wood are called New Wood; Large Living Wood are called Old Wood.
Speed. Your walking speed is 30 feet if you are Medium. Your walking speed is 20 feet if you are Large.
Age. Living Wood typically live between 100 and 150 years.
Languages. You can speak, read, and write Common and Druidic.
Skill Proficiency. You gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: Survival, Animal Handling, Nature, or History.
Wooden Frame. While you are not wearing armor, your Armor Class equals 10 + your Constitution modifier. You can still benefit from a shield.
Rooted Awareness. While you are in contact with the ground, you have tremorsense out to 30 feet.
Barkbound Resilience. You have resistance to nonmagical bludgeoning damage.
Grasping Limbs. When you successfully grapple a creature smaller than you, you can choose to restrain it instead. The restrained creature can use its action to attempt to escape, following the normal rules for ending a grapple.
